**ESTIMATED CHATBOT-READY:** 60-70% (content exists but needs reformatting)
**CRITICAL GAPS:** Conversation flows, personality, stage playbooks, decision trees

---

sections.title: B. Example Conversation Flow (Template)
sections.content:
**FLOW NAME:** [Problem type]
**TRIGGER:** [Founder statement that activates this flow]
**GOAL:** [Diagnosis and 1-3 prioritised recommendations]

**FLOW STEPS:**

**[Step 1] Opening**
- Empathetic acknowledgement
- Set context for conversation

**[Step 2] Clarifying Questions**
- Foundation check (Governance → Purpose → Strategy)
- 3-5 targeted questions maximum
- Branch based on answers

**[Step 3] Diagnosis**
- Identify root cause (not just symptom)
- Explain interconnections
- Reference research/statistics

**[Step 4] Recommendations**
- Immediate action (1 task, <1 week)
- Short-term actions (2-3 tasks, this month)
- Link to tools/frameworks

**[Step 5] Next Steps**
- Ask which they'll tackle first
- Offer to explain any tool
- Set expectation for follow-up

**EXAMPLE DIALOGUE:**
```
[Full conversation written out showing chatbot and founder exchanges]
```

---

**END OF GAP ANALYSIS**

**Prepared by:** Claude Code
**For:** Jane Korneyko, Sova
**Date:** 27 November 2025
**Version:** 1.0

**Next Steps:** Review this analysis, prioritise Tier 1 recommendations, begin mapping 5 core conversation flows.

MASTER_RESOURCE_LIBRARY.md.content:
# Sova Master Resource Library

**Total Resources:** 579 hyperlinks

This document contains ALL hyperlinks from the assessment tool and tools library.
The chatbot should use this to recommend specific resources with working links.

---

## Finance (58 resources)

### Discovery Stage

- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

- **"Running Out of Cash - 29% of startups fail because they run out of money — insufficient funds and poor cash flow management"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **"Unable to Raise Funds - Starting fundraising too late when operations deteriorate prevents securing necessary capital"** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **The single most significant factor we see in start-up failure due to fundraising is starting fundraising too late, often because things are going ok, and then they aren’t. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Market Analysis & Go-to-Market (25% weight). VCs check: TAM >$1B, SAM defined, competitive analysis, customer discovery completed. Red flags: No market sising, copying competitors, no differentiation.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://press.farm/andreessen-horowitzs-investment-criteria/

- **"Finance Problems (16%) - Cash flow constraints limiting growth validation; premature scaling without validated models. 75% were self-funded, yet only 16% pointed to financial problems"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Most entrepreneurs who launch with insufficient funding, product or service prices that are not market-related, or optimistic sales projections end up with a failing startup.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats

- **The surest way to avoid financial failure is to develop a business model with a predictable path to revenue and profitability.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/article-why-startups-fail-lessons-150-founders

- **https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

- **"Undercapitalisation - Insufficient capital prevents startups from pursuing opportunities and maintaining solvency when cash flow problems arise"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10881814/

- **The research backs this up. Data shows that 78% of startups are self-funded. Real entrepreneurs have genuine skin in the game.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **Founders should have invested, at minimum, four to six months of living expenses or 10-20% of their liquid net worth before seeking co-founders or capital.** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

- **https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Obsess over cash flow projections and monitor burn rate. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

### Efficiency Stage

- **VC Criteria: Financial Controls & Burn Rate. VCs check: Monthly reporting, cash flow managed, burn rate reasonable vs runway. Benchmark: Need 12-18mo runway, LTV/CAC >3x for funding.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **"Scale-Up Financial Complexity - Estimating expenditure correctly becomes significantly more difficult during scale-up phase beyond investor relations challenges"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Seek advice from experienced entrepreneurs who have gone through the process before, as they can provide valuable insight and feedback.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Financial Controls & Burn Rate. VCs check: Monthly reporting, cash flow managed, burn rate reasonable vs runway. Benchmark: Need 12-18mo runway, LTV/CAC >3x for funding.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **"Mismanagement of Growth - Premature scaling affected 70% of startups — uncontrolled rapid growth burns cash faster than revenue generation"** (Quote (startup failure))

  - URL: https://dpr648.medium.com/is-my-market-size-big-enough-to-raise-venture-capital-f9e06ad2bef4

- **The founders who survived all tracked one specific number. The ones who didn’t? They’re no longer in business. That number is Customer Lifetime Value to Customer Acquisition Cost ratio (LTV:CAC). And if you’re not tracking it, you’re flying blind.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://medium.com/marketing-magic/why-i-now-refuse-to-work-with-founders-who-wont-track-this-one-number-e2da108a2e9c

- **Start small and scale slowly in conjunction with validated customer demand.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Startup idea validation is the process of systematically assessing the viability of your concept.  It’s about stepping outside your own enthusiasm and gathering real-world data to determine if there’s a genuine market need for your offering. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://foundersnetwork.com/startup-idea-validation-mistakes/

- **Pre-sales Validation** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://lukasniessen.medium.com/presales-how-to-get-the-technical-validation-what-tradeoffs-are-there-7de7326eebcd

- **LOI Templates** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://lawpath.com.au/legal-documents/letter-of-intent?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&keyword=&matchtype=&device=c&adposition=&campaignid=8662387112&utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=02-20_Documents-DSA_Text-Ads&keyword=&matchtype=&device=c&adposition=&campaignid=8662387112&gad_source=1&gad_campaignid=8662387112&gbraid=0AAAAACjWV9tL64B38t3C1HPIabx86w64H&gclid=CjwKCAiA_orJBhBNEiwABkdmjIIozyn7LAq48m2zSYgAvCW5pDhZCdRb4F5KbOxjw1HW7zoxQmEyQBoCDsYQAvD_BwE

- **Pilot Program** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.productled.org/blog/framework-driving-product-market-fit-pilots

- **Evidence of customer intent is critical for Market Analysis (25% weight). VCs distinguish between 'Would you buy this?' (false positives) and 'Will you buy this today?' (truth). Pre-orders, paid pilots, and Letters of Intent prove willingness to pay. 70% of startups ask wrong questions to wrong people  —  VCs fund those who validate with real commitments.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.forentrepreneurs.com/saas-metrics-2/

- **Research-Free Launch - Launching without thorough market research is a recipe for financial loss; demand validation is crucial before investment** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

sections.title: Sova Master Resource Library
sections.content:
**Total Resources:** 579 hyperlinks

This document contains ALL hyperlinks from the assessment tool and tools library.
The chatbot should use this to recommend specific resources with working links.

---

sections.title: Discovery Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

- **"Running Out of Cash - 29% of startups fail because they run out of money — insufficient funds and poor cash flow management"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **"Unable to Raise Funds - Starting fundraising too late when operations deteriorate prevents securing necessary capital"** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **The single most significant factor we see in start-up failure due to fundraising is starting fundraising too late, often because things are going ok, and then they aren’t. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Market Analysis & Go-to-Market (25% weight). VCs check: TAM >$1B, SAM defined, competitive analysis, customer discovery completed. Red flags: No market sising, copying competitors, no differentiation.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://press.farm/andreessen-horowitzs-investment-criteria/

- **"Finance Problems (16%) - Cash flow constraints limiting growth validation; premature scaling without validated models. 75% were self-funded, yet only 16% pointed to financial problems"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Most entrepreneurs who launch with insufficient funding, product or service prices that are not market-related, or optimistic sales projections end up with a failing startup.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats

- **The surest way to avoid financial failure is to develop a business model with a predictable path to revenue and profitability.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/article-why-startups-fail-lessons-150-founders

- **https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

- **"Undercapitalisation - Insufficient capital prevents startups from pursuing opportunities and maintaining solvency when cash flow problems arise"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10881814/

- **The research backs this up. Data shows that 78% of startups are self-funded. Real entrepreneurs have genuine skin in the game.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **Founders should have invested, at minimum, four to six months of living expenses or 10-20% of their liquid net worth before seeking co-founders or capital.** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **VC Criteria: Financial Planning & Runway (15% weight). VCs check: 12-month cash flow forecast, separate business/personal finances, startup costs known. Benchmark: 47% fail from lack of capital. Need 18+ months runway.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.scaleup.finance/article/startup-runway-guide-how-much-cash-buffer-you-really-need-in-2025

  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

sections.title: Efficiency Stage
sections.content:

  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (startup failure) 2)

  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

Investors want to see a clear vision, a clear pathway to success, and evidence that you can follow through.** (Quote (best practice))

sections.title: Scale Stage
sections.content:

  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/** (Quote (best practice))

  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate** (Quote (startup failure))

  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **VC Criteria: Path to Profitability & Exit Readiness (15% weight). VCs check: Unit economics positive, revenue growth >100% YoY, clear path to profitability. Benchmark: Need $1M+ ARR for Series A, $10M+ for Series B.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Financial Mismanagement - Companies run out of money due to poor capital allocation. Red flags include excess debt, weak spending controls, high customer acquisition costs, over-dependence on single revenue streams."** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **VC Criteria: Path to Profitability & Exit Readiness (15% weight). VCs check: Unit economics positive, revenue growth >100% YoY, clear path to profitability. Benchmark: Need $1M+ ARR for Series A, $10M+ for Series B.** (VC requirements mapping)

  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Cynefin** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://thecynefin.co/about-us/about-cynefin-framework/

- **VRIO** (Tool/Framework 6)
  - URL: https://www.mindtools.com/a182jt9/vrio-analysis

- **VC Criteria: Financial Controls & Burn Rate. VCs check: Monthly reporting, cash flow managed, burn rate reasonable vs runway. Benchmark: Need 12-18mo runway, LTV/CAC >3x for funding.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Postponing Next-Round Funding Too Long - Delaying investor outreach until cash crisis, making fundraising rushed and limiting strategic partnership opportunities. You need to partner with investors who can fund successive rounds."** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Often early on, startups are interested in any source of funds. They don’t vet their investors. They need to partner with investors who can fund successive rounds of investment. ** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Discovery Stage
sections.content:
- **Sova - Australian Startup Setup Guide** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Setup%20Guide.pdf

- **Business.gov.au checklist** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/-/media/business-information/templates-and-tools/starting-a-business-checklist.docx?sc_lang=en&hash=4F7A8FAF11CCE7CCC1D2A4D44111C30D

- **Business Structure Guide** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/

- **Sova - Australian Startup Setup Guide** (Resources)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Setup%20Guide.pdf

- **VCs look for legal foundations first. They check whether you've properly registered your business (ABN/ACN), started protecting your intellectual property (trademarks filed), and have a founders' agreement with equity vesting (4-year standard with 1-year cliff). Red flags include unclear ownership structures, no legal entity, or missing insurance coverage.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.diligent.com/resources/blog/corporate-governance-for-startups-vc-investors

- **Governance Problems - Lack of foundational legal structure, compliance oversight, and board governance creates operational vulnerability and limits investment readiness** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.dilitrust.com/startup-corporate-governance/

- **Shareholders Agreement Template** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://lawpath.com.au/legal-documents/shareholders-deed-more-than-2-shareholders?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&keyword=&matchtype=&device=c&adposition=&campaignid=8662387112&utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=02-20_Documents-DSA_Text-Ads&keyword=&matchtype=&device=c&adposition=&campaignid=8662387112&gad_source=1&gad_campaignid=8662387112&gbraid=0AAAAACjWV9uWQtioB32CsY8fG--n-XLlk&gclid=CjwKCAjw04HIBhB8EiwA8jGNbcl2qIr18sBsKTGKY0I59Bbjt7Xk_VKIFZwqRKFKh9SNCvAiamEx6xoCZPkQAvD_BwE

- **This is critical for VCs  —  Team & Management carries 30% weight in their evaluation. They want to see a written founders' agreement with equity vesting (4 years with 1-year cliff is standard), documented roles and responsibilities, clear decision-making authority, and a dispute resolution process. Major red flags: no written agreement, equal 50/50 splits without tie-breaker mechanisms, or verbal agreements only.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.diligent.com/resources/blog/corporate-governance-for-startups-vc-investors

- **Shareholder Disagreement - Differences of opinion among founders create disputes when foundational strategy and conflict resolution aren't established** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Core Values Canvas** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.fearlessculture.design/blog-posts/the-core-values-canvas

- **Brene Brown - Dare to Lead, List of Values** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://brenebrown.com/resources/dare-to-lead-list-of-values/

- **RAPID framework** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://www.mindtools.com/av8ceid/bains-rapid-framework

- **VCs assess your decision-making capability as part of Team & Management evaluation (30% weight). They look for structured frameworks showing you won't make reactive decisions. Having trusted advisors, clear values, and systematic decision processes demonstrates founder maturity. Strong decision frameworks signal you'll navigate challenges effectively rather than pivoting chaotically.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **Insufficient Network/Allies - Lack of referral sources and industry connections limits growth acceleration and credibility** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Don’t attempt the entrepreneurial journey solo. Numerous startups fail because they lack a robust network of supporters who can help promote their business. This includes organisations embarking on similar ventures, suppliers who can cater to startup needs, and industry veterans who have already achieved success. ** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Ensure that the co-founders agree on company objectives, goals, and strategies.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Efficiency Stage
sections.content:
- **Sova - Australian Startup Setup Guide** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Setup%20Guide.pdf

- **Business.gov.au checklist** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/-/media/business-information/templates-and-tools/starting-a-business-checklist.docx?sc_lang=en&hash=4F7A8FAF11CCE7CCC1D2A4D44111C30D

- **Business Structure Guide** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/

- **Sova - Australian Startup Setup Guide** (Resources)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Setup%20Guide.pdf

- **VCs look for legal foundations first. They check whether you've properly registered your business (ABN/ACN), started protecting your intellectual property (trademarks filed), and have a founders' agreement with equity vesting (4-year standard with 1-year cliff). Red flags include unclear ownership structures, no legal entity, or missing insurance coverage.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.diligent.com/resources/blog/corporate-governance-for-startups-vc-investors

- **Governance Problems - Lack of foundational legal structure, compliance oversight, and board governance creates operational vulnerability and limits investment readiness** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.dilitrust.com/startup-corporate-governance/

- **Australian Business Procedure Templates** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://business.vic.gov.au/tools-and-templates?page=1

- **Formal governance increases funding success significantly  —  startups with documented policies raise 2.3x more capital. VCs evaluate Governance Structure (30% weight) by checking for clear decision frameworks, written policies for recurring decisions, and scalable processes. This proves you're building a business, not winging it.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.diligent.com/resources/blog/corporate-governance-for-startups-vc-investors

- **Founder Quality - VCs look for founders with resilience, passion, and experience leading start-up teams   —   the right stuff matters more than the idea** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10881814/

- **Growth mindset** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://online.hbs.edu/blog/post/growth-mindset-vs-fixed-mindset

- **Pivot Framework** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/pivot-framework-guide-adaptive-leadership-datie-irxkc

- **VCs value flexibility and learning capability (Risk Management & Compliance assessment). Advisory board presence is a positive signal  —  it shows you seek expert guidance and adapt based on evidence. Rigid founders who ignore contradictory data kill their startups. VCs fund those who iterate intelligently, not stubbornly defend failing approaches.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Why is it that so many smart people kill their own ideas? Stubboness. That’s often the culprit.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://medium.com/futurist-jim-carroll-daily-inspiration/the-disease-of-stubbornness-64e4e0f83f81

- **Not Being Agile - Rigidly adhering to plans without adapting to market changes, competitive threats, or unforeseen circumstances. Make small, daily, incremental changes.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Be open to feedback that can help you improve the overall quality of your service or product.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Work with mentors and advisors who can help guide you through business challenges. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Regulatory compliance** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.aicd.com.au/regulatory-compliance.html

- **PESTLE** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/how-effectively-conduct-pestle-analysis-when-launching-saleh-zeer-5iy4f/

- **Regulatory compliance and adaptability matter for Risk Management assessment. VCs check: Are you current with tax (GST, BAS, PAYG)? Do you have adequate insurance? Do you monitor regulatory changes? 36% of startups fail from inflexibility when rules shift. Staying compliant protects their investment and shows operational maturity.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.diligent.com/resources/blog/corporate-governance-for-startups-vc-investors

- **Market Adaptation Failure - Whether it's consumer preference shifts or black swan events like coronavirus, startups must adapt quickly to survive** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Stay abreast of the latest industry news, trends, and consumer behaviors. This will give you an understanding of what changes may be coming down the line and how they may affect your business. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **McKinsey 7S Framework** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.prosci.com/blog/the-mckinsey-7-s-model

- **Continuous Improvement Tools** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://asana.com/resources/process-improvement-methodologies

- **VCs evaluate governance evolution (Risk Management & Compliance). Regularly updating your governance based on learnings, market shifts, and expert feedback demonstrates adaptability. What works at 10 customers breaks at 100. VCs want founders who evolve their systems proactively, not reactively after problems emerge.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.affinity.co/guides/due-diligence-checklist-for-venture-capital

- **Pivot Necessity - 75% of startups change their initial ideas as the market landscape shifts; rigidly clinging to original plans guarantees failure** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/operations-blog/five-lessons-from-scaling-a-start-up

- **Unforeseen situations occur, market trends change and aggressive competitors can pop up out of nowhere. Consequently, you may need to change course quickly at one point or another.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Try to keep up with trends in your industry and be open to feedback that can help you improve the overall quality of your service or product.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Scale Stage
sections.content:
- **Eisenhower Matrix** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.eisenhower.me/eisenhower-matrix/

- **Delegation Framework** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://blog.hptbydts.com/7-models-for-delegation

- **Investor-Ready Governance is critical for Series A+ funding. VCs check: Is your board structure scalable (3-5 experienced members for $5M+ rounds)? Do you have investor relations processes? Is there an exit strategy documented? Delegation to capable managers frees founders for strategy  —  VCs won't fund founder-bottleneck businesses.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **Founder Over-Extension - I quickly became stretched too thin and lost connection with staff; the entire enterprise began to lose focus and flounder** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Bring on contractors/freelancers to flex capacity up or down.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Advisory Board Building** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.aicd.com.au/board-of-directors/advisory.html

- **Mentoring programs** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://launchvic.org/programs/office-hours/

- **Adviser Finder** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/expertise-and-advice

- **Leadership depth matters for scaling  —  VCs need to see experienced leaders running major functions, not founders doing everything. Strong advisory boards and mentors (Advisory Board Building) signal you attract quality people and delegate effectively. For Series A+, VCs evaluate whether your leadership team can execute a $10M+ growth plan.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Team Problems - 23% of startups fail from missing expertise and weak leadership. Early-stage teams lack experienced leaders who can scale operations, resulting in founder burnout and operational chaos as complexity increases.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Insufficient Network/Allies - Lack of referral sources and industry connections limits growth acceleration and credibility** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Seek advice from experienced entrepreneurs who have gone through the process before, as they can provide valuable insight and feedback.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Talk with mentors, peers, and industry leaders about their experiences; often, those who have been through similar scenarios can provide valuable insight and advice. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Action Priority Matrix** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.productplan.com/glossary/action-priority-matrix/

- **McKinsey 7S** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/strategy-and-corporate-finance/our-insights/enduring-ideas-the-7-s-framework

- **Clear priorities drive execution at scale (Investor-Ready Governance, critical for Series A+). VCs check: Can everyone articulate the top 3 priorities? Do you use frameworks like OKRs or V2MOM? Communication systems must scale  —  confusion kills execution. Startups that can't communicate priorities clearly can't scale effectively.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.affinity.co/guides/due-diligence-checklist-for-venture-capital

- **To expect communication naturally evolves with growth, for instance, is a false assumption many startup founders make. It’s obviously a lot easier to communicate changes and progress to a few other people, versus 10, 50 or even 1000 other people.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Communication Doesn't Scale Naturally - False assumption that communication evolves automatically; communicating changes to 1000 people differs fundamentally from 10** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **If your business goals, product development goals, marketing iniatives, and team communications are becoming confusing or uncertain, this won’t go over well in your next pitch meeting. Investors want to see a clear vision, a clear pathway to success, and evidence that you can follow through.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **As a startup founder, it's essential to be aware of your leadership's impact on your team. Set clear expectations for yourself and your employees and give them the support they need to reach their goals. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Communication Frameworks** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://noahlk.medium.com/key-communication-frameworks-for-individual-contributors-e18142a2c66f

- **Stakeholder Management** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/advice/0/what-best-tools-stakeholder-analysis-engagement

- **Scalable communication systems are essential for Investor-Ready Governance. VCs evaluate: Do you have clear channels (real-time, formal updates, alignment meetings)? Are response expectations documented? Who needs to know what, when, and how? Poor communication creates duplicate work, missed opportunities, and chaos. Series A+ requires operational maturity.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Lacking Scalable Infrastructure - Failing to systematically establish communication systems, IT redundancy, and operational procedures for growing team sise. You need to invest in your company's communication infrastructure.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

sections.title: Validation Stage
sections.content:
- **Business Plan template** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/planning/business-plans/develop-your-business-plan

- **RACI Matrix (for teams)** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Responsibility_assignment_matrix

- **RAPID Decision Framework (for teams)** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.mindtools.com/av8ceid/bains-rapid-framework

- **Governance Structure matters significantly to VCs (30% weight under Team & Management). They look for clear decision-making processes, documented roles and responsibilities, and appropriate board composition for your stage. Research shows startups with formal governance structures raise 2.3x more capital  —  it signals professionalism and reduces investor risk.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **Misaligned Co-Founder Expectations - Unspoken assumptions create partnership breakdown. 24% of co-founder relationships dissolve within four years** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC10881814/

- **As Dima Maslennikov notes in his recent Entrepreneur.com article on co-founder alignment, misaligned expectations and unspoken assumptions are among the top reasons partnerships break down. His research shows that 24% of co-founder relationships dissolve within four years, often because initial commitment levels were mismatched from day one.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **Sova - Australian Startup Tax Checklist** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Tax%20Checklist.pdf

- **PESTLE** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/how-effectively-conduct-pestle-analysis-when-launching-saleh-zeer-5iy4f/

- **Compliance framework** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://www.halladvisory.com/single-post/compliance-frameworks-getting-clarity-on-appropriate-structure-and-depth

- **Sova - Australian Startup Tax Checklist** (Resources)
  - URL: ../inbox/Allivate/_archives/assessment-tool-rebuild/Sova%20-%20Australian%20Startup%20Tax%20Checklist.pdf

- **VCs check Risk Management & Compliance rigorously. They want current tax compliance (GST, BAS, PAYG all filed), adequate insurance coverage, and all regulatory requirements met for your industry. An advisory board is a positive signal. Flexibility to pivot within compliance shows strong governance  —  rigidity kills startups when regulations change.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Startups must pay taxes and superannuation, maintain workers’ compensation insurance and meet other statutory obligations like all other businesses. Understanding these obligations is essential and should inform budgets and financial modelling. ** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Missing taxes, superannuation, and insurance obligations damages creditworthiness and business value** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

---

sections.title: Discovery Stage
sections.content:
- **Customer Persona** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona/persona-examples

- **ICP Framework** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://medium.com/@arpit-mishra/a-step-by-step-guide-to-creating-an-ideal-customer-profile-icp-1f30723925e1

- **How I Interview Customers** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.strategyzer.com/library/8-tips-for-conducting-interviews-that-deliver-relevant-customer-insights

- **The Mom Test** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://www.productfocus.com/the-mom-test/

- **Jobs To Be Done** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://jtbd.info/2-what-is-jobs-to-be-done-jtbd-796b82081cca

- **Market Understanding carries 25% weight for VCs. They check whether your Ideal Customer Profile is specific (not 'everyone' or 'small businesses'), your value proposition is clear, and you've validated willingness to pay. 76% of successful companies use detailed ICPs because specificity drives everything  —  marketing, product, pricing. 'Everyone' is not a market VCs will fund.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.pitchdrive.com/academy/what-vc-look-for-in-startups

- **Asking customers what they want is a trap. They don't know. Instead, ask about their current behaviour and problems. - Rob Fitzpatrick, The Mom Test** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail

- **No Market Demand - 35% fail because no market need exists for the product   —   launching without thorough market research reveals products lack viable market need** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats

- **SOSTAC** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://medium.com/@danielkikuli/why-sme-must-consider-sostac-framework-ed36559d24bd

- **Customer Journey Mapping** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://blog.startupstash.com/customer-journey-mapping-in-10-steps-a-practical-guide-46b43ec14cdb

- **Design thinking** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.interaction-design.org/literature/topics/design-thinking

- **Customer Persona** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona/persona-examples

- **Value Proposition Canvas** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://www.strategyzer.com/library/the-value-proposition-canvas

- **Marketing Plan** (Tool/Framework 6)
  - URL: https://www.momtestbook.com/

- **VCs assess your Market Understanding & ICP Definition (25% weight). A marketing strategy proves you know how to find and win customers systematically, not hope they'll discover you. They want to see channel testing, customer persona clarity, and evidence you understand what messaging resonates. Marketing without strategy is just spending money and hoping.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.pitchdrive.com/academy/what-vc-look-for-in-startups

- **Focusing on Marketing Too Little or Too Late - Underinvesting in strategic marketing or depending on single channels, limiting scalability and creating vulnerability** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Neglecting Marketing and Sales - 14% of startups fail because of poor marketing efforts   —   founders focus on product while ignoring customer acquisition** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2025/01/6-lessons-for-startups-from-a-museum-dedicated-to-failure

sections.title: Efficiency Stage
sections.content:
- **Marketing Plan** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://business.gov.au/planning/business-plans/develop-your-marketing-plan

- **Channel Mix Strategy** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://businessmarketingengine.com/the-channel-mix-marketing/

- **Channel diversification reduces risk in Customer Acquisition evaluation (20% weight). VCs check: Are you testing multiple channels? If one channel delivers >50% of customers, that's a vulnerability (algorithm changes, cost spikes). They want to see systematic testing and balanced channel mix  —  proof you won't collapse if one channel fails.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://press.farm/andreessen-horowitzs-investment-criteria/

- **Single-Channel Dependence - Scaling requires strategic marketing channel diversity with clear KPIs and ROIs, not dependence on single channels** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **Ensure you have a strong presence on the right social media channels and utilise them to their fullest potential.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Customer Retention Strategy** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-retention-strategies

- **LTV:CAC Ratio** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://online.hbs.edu/blog/post/ltv-cac

- **Churn Reduction Tactics** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://userpilot.com/blog/churn-prevention-saas/

- **VCs track Customer Acquisition & PMF metrics (20% weight) carefully: CAC, LTV, retention rate, payback period. Benchmark for B2B SaaS: CAC <$500, payback <12 months, monthly churn <5%. Focusing equally on acquisition and retention proves you understand unit economics. Retention costs 5-25x less than acquisition  —  VCs fund efficient growth.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **Customer Service Orientation (66% of sample) - Prioritised new customer acquisition over retention; focused on technological solutions rather than customer needs** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail

sections.title: Scale Stage
sections.content:
- **Referral Program** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.zendesk.com/au/blog/customer-referral-program/

- **Customer Advocacy Framework** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://khoros.com/blog/customer-advocacy

- **Word of Mouth Strategy** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.investopedia.com/terms/w/word-of-mouth-marketing.asp

- **Scalable Acquisition & Market Leadership means building systematic referral programs, not hoping customers talk about you. VCs check: Do you have referral systems (ask at right moments, make it effortless, reward both parties)? When channels saturate, can you adapt? Market saturation forces costly acquisition  —  VCs want diversified, systematic approaches.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://press.farm/andreessen-horowitzs-investment-criteria/

- **Referral Power - Referrals backed by trust and personal endorsements spread awareness while enhancing credibility, unlike traditional marketing** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Customer Experience Design** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.interaction-design.org/literature/topics/customer-experience?srsltid=AfmBOoqrdgflN0n8JCwobh0PFAFjClZ8z5suaCexiu2Zvzg_uvSMpglX

- **Service Design Thinking** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.interaction-design.org/literature/article/the-principles-of-service-design-thinking-building-better-services?srsltid=AfmBOor6WuYbH1bXXgIViWO7CZ-GcTS8y2cnrPWPAkyQB4FTHdQedDbO

- **Experience Innovation** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://www.forbes.com/sites/blakemorgan/2019/10/21/20-fresh-examples-of-customer-experience-innovation/

- **Experience differentiation becomes your moat when products commoditise (Scalable Acquisition & Market Leadership). VCs evaluate: Are you creating memorable experiences customers can't get elsewhere? Disney isn't rides, it's magic. Apple isn't computers, it's belonging. At scale, remarkable experiences drive word-of-mouth and premium pricing.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Competitive Reality - Assume competitors already exist; your product may not be as unique as you think. Differentiation requires deliberate strategy** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Brand Differentiation** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.forbes.com/sites/rhettpower/2024/07/07/the-art-of-brand-differentiation-strategies-for-lasting-impact/

- **Marketing Frameworks** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-frameworks

- **Marketing Innovation** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://camphouse.io/blog/innovative-marketing

- **Marketing as a competitive advantage means your marketing itself is remarkable enough that people talk about it (Scalable Acquisition & Market Leadership). Cards Against Humanity's marketing IS their brand. Dollar Shave Club's video built the business. VCs recognise when marketing transcends promotion and becomes product  —  that's a defensible moat.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Single-Channel Risk - Putting all growth efforts in one channel basket creates vulnerability; channel diversification is essential for scaling** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

sections.title: Validation Stage
sections.content:
- **Good Activation Rate** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.lowcode.agency/glossary/activation-rate-in-startup-metrics

- **AARRR Pirate Metrics** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.productplan.com/glossary/aarrr-framework/

- **Activation Metric** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://posthog.com/product-engineers/activation-metrics

- **DAU/MAU Engagement** (Tool/Framework 4)
  - URL: https://userpilot.com/blog/dau-mau-ratio/

- **Customer Acquisition & PMF evaluation (20% weight) includes whether you understand customer success metrics. VCs check: Have you tested multiple channels? Calculated CAC? Measured retention? Got product-market fit evidence? Benchmark for B2B SaaS: CAC under $500, payback period under 12 months. Without these, you're guessing, not growing.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://press.farm/andreessen-horowitzs-investment-criteria/

- **No matter how many features, no matter how great the UX, no matter how cool the AI, if people don’t care, or don’t want to pay for it, or want it to work differently, then your company will fail.** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://longform.asmartbear.com/find-customers-to-interview/

- **DAU/MAU ratio of 20%+ is good for most consumer products. If it's dropping, you have an engagement problem before you have a growth problem. - Lenny Rachitsky** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.lennysnewsletter.com/p/what-is-good-retention-issue-29

- **Pre-Launch Tactics** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://www.shopify.com/au/blog/16684812-the-real-secret-to-launching-a-successful-store-to-thousands-of-excited-customers

- **Early stage marketing** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.forbes.com/sites/abdoriani/2024/10/19/7-easy-steps-to-improve-your-early-stage-startup-marketing-strategy/

- **AARRR Framework** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://ms-mbalke.medium.com/aarrr-framework-metrics-that-let-your-startup-sound-like-a-pirate-ship-e91d4082994b

- **VCs assess Customer Acquisition & PMF (20% weight) by checking whether you allocated marketing resources from day one or waited until launch. Marketing is half your business, not an afterthought. They want evidence you tested channels early, measured results, and built momentum pre-launch. Starting marketing at launch wastes 6-12 months of potential traction.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://thecfoclub.com/metrics/saas-gross-margin-benchmarks/

- **Poor Marketing Execution - 14% of startups fail because of poor marketing efforts; founders focus all energy on product development and neglect critical marketing activities** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Marketing can’t be an afterthought. Set aside at least 15% of funds for marketing activities like content creation, digital ads, referrals, and PR. Leverage low-cost strategies like social media you get started.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

---

sections.title: Discovery Stage
sections.content:
- **Agile methodology** (Tool/Framework 6)
  - URL: https://web.stanford.edu/group/e145/cgi-bin/winter/drupal/upload/handouts/Four_Steps.pdf

- **VC Criteria: Founder/Team Quality (30% weight - highest!). VCs check: Complementary skills, co-founder equity alignment, previous success. Benchmark: 24% of co-founder relationships fail. Vesting prevents disasters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **MoSCoW** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://www.mindtools.com/a4xmovt/the-moscow-method

- **PDSA** (Tool/Framework 6)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2013/05/why-the-lean-start-up-changes-everything

- **VC Criteria: Founder/Team Quality (30% weight - highest!). VCs check: Complementary skills, co-founder equity alignment, previous success. Benchmark: 24% of co-founder relationships fail. Vesting prevents disasters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats

- **https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **VC Criteria: Founder/Team Quality (30% weight - highest!). VCs check: Complementary skills, co-founder equity alignment, previous success. Benchmark: 24% of co-founder relationships fail. Vesting prevents disasters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **"Mistaking Leadership for Management - Founders over-managing operational details instead of delegating, losing organisational focus and employee autonomy. I quickly became stretched too thin."** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **In some cases, a startup fails because the founders don’t have the necessary qualifications or experience. Ideally, entrepreneurs should be industry experts with sufficient business experience.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://explodingtopics.com/blog/startup-failure-stats

- **Map out the core skill sets you need to start — technical, design, marketing, and sales — and fill any gaps in your team. Consider co-founding with someone who has complementary abilities.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **VC Criteria: Founder/Team Quality (30% weight - highest!). VCs check: Complementary skills, co-founder equity alignment, previous success. Benchmark: 24% of co-founder relationships fail. Vesting prevents disasters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/03/how-venture-capitalists-make-decisions

- **"Missing Critical Skills - Human capital gaps prevent startups from scaling effectively; having the right people at the right time is essential"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Efficiency Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Talent & Retention. VCs check: Key person risk mitigated, retention high, development plans exist. Benchmark: Advisory board presence signals strong network and mentorship.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Team Problems (18%) - Missing domain expertise; co-founder friction; low motivation"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Carefully review the business plan and ensure all costs, timelines, market research, and proposed models are realistic. Taking the time to do so will help you better understand what needs to be done to launch your startup successfully.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **VC Criteria: Talent & Retention. VCs check: Key person risk mitigated, retention high, development plans exist. Benchmark: Advisory board presence signals strong network and mentorship.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Failing to Hire the Right People - Nearly 25% fail by not assembling teams with diverse skills and experience needed"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **VC Criteria: Talent & Retention. VCs check: Key person risk mitigated, retention high, development plans exist. Benchmark: Advisory board presence signals strong network and mentorship.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Ensuring everyone has the space, resources, and opportunities to do their best work and have their voices be heard is key to a harmonious work environment. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Scale Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Leadership Depth & Scalability (30% weight). VCs check: VP-level leadership, succession planning, talent attraction capability. Benchmark: 25% fail from not hiring right people. Senior leadership critical for $5M+ rounds.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Hiring Prematurely - Rapid hiring to meet immediate demands without proper screening, resulting in cultural misfit and productivity decline. One of the biggest mistakes was to hire people prematurely. Employees started sharing bad habits."** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **"Wrong Team Composition - Mismanaging hiring—either expanding too rapidly or relying on early-stage team lacking corporate experience—stunts growth"** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **Another frequent mistake is the assumption that scaling necessitates a large increase in staff, leading to rapid workforce expansion. This approach can quickly become financially unsustainable, resulting in a bloated payroll that drains resources and may lead to failure.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **When hiring employees, ensure that you consider not only their skills and experience but also their attitude and ability to work in a team. Results and experience matter when it comes to professional success, but if your potential hires don't have the right mindset or work ethic, it is likely they won't be a good fit for your company. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Leadership Depth & Scalability (30% weight). VCs check: VP-level leadership, succession planning, talent attraction capability. Benchmark: 25% fail from not hiring right people. Senior leadership critical for $5M+ rounds.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Not hiring right people - Poor recruitment decisions lacking consideration of skills, attitude, and teamwork ability"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Business leaders inspire others, have the vision, make connections, and secure funding for their companies’ continued growth. They’re idea machines. These are not necessarily the same qualities found in a good manager. It’s important to leave the execution to those who are great at that.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **Some startups rely too heavily on their original team members, who, despite being capable of managing early-stage growth, may lack the necessary skills and experience for later stages. That dependence can hold back a startup’s development and prevent it from achieving its full potential. Startups need to strike a balance between leveraging fresh perspectives with the insights of existing employees.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **VC Criteria: Leadership Depth & Scalability (30% weight). VCs check: VP-level leadership, succession planning, talent attraction capability. Benchmark: 25% fail from not hiring right people. Senior leadership critical for $5M+ rounds.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/article-10-lessons-150-founders-learned-hard-way** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://startupsmagazine.co.uk/article-10-lessons-150-founders-learned-hard-way

- **As a startup founder, it's essential to be aware of your leadership's impact on your team. Set clear expectations for yourself and your employees and give them the support they need to reach their goals. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **Encourage an environment of transparency, constructive feedback, and empathy among your team. Implementing feedback surveys (and listening to the feedback) or setting up times for team members to communicate and discuss their disagreements is essential for resolving conflicts. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **VC Criteria: Leadership Depth & Scalability (30% weight). VCs check: VP-level leadership, succession planning, talent attraction capability. Benchmark: 25% fail from not hiring right people. Senior leadership critical for $5M+ rounds.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://thecfoclub.com/metrics/saas-gross-margin-benchmarks/

- **https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Encourage an environment of transparency, constructive feedback, and empathy among your team. Implementing feedback surveys (and listening to the feedback) or setting up times for team members to communicate and discuss their disagreements is essential for resolving conflicts. ** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **Ensuring everyone has the space, resources, and opportunities to do their best work and have their voices be heard is key to a harmonious work environment. ** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Validation Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Team Capability & Culture. VCs check: Right skills for stage, culture defined, hiring process clear. Benchmark: Team problems cause 18% of failures. Execution capability matters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Founder Skill Limitations - Fatal mistake believing you can handle all functional roles beyond initial startup phase; expertise gaps must be addressed"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **Problems like lack of domain knowledge, lack of marketing knowledge (and plan), lack of technical knowledge, and finally – lack of business knowledge are the biggest killers.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.cbinsights.com/research/startup-failure-reasons-top/

- **VC Criteria: Talent & Retention. VCs check: Key person risk mitigated, retention high, development plans exist. Benchmark: Advisory board presence signals strong network and mentorship.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

sections.title: Discovery Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Metrics & Data-Driven Culture. VCs check: Key metrics defined (3-5 North Star metrics), baseline tracked, goals set. Benchmark: 36% fail from not tracking right metrics. Measure what matters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Analytical Thinking Failure - 36% of failed startups never tracked metrics that mattered, making improvement impossible"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://blog.growthinstitute.com/scale-up-blueprint/10-mistakes-startups-make-under-rapid-growth

- **Entrepreneurs should invest time in understanding their target market, pricing strategies, sales channels, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to develop a robust business model.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **VC Criteria: Metrics & Data-Driven Culture. VCs check: Key metrics defined (3-5 North Star metrics), baseline tracked, goals set. Benchmark: 36% fail from not tracking right metrics. Measure what matters.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Pattern Recognition Failure - Most startup failures stem from repeated errors business owners fail to recognise and correct, not bad luck"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Efficiency Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Unit Economics & Efficiency Metrics. VCs check: CAC payback <12mo, LTV/CAC >3x, gross margin >70%, improving trends. Benchmark: Operational leverage improving as you scale.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **VC Criteria: Growth & Traction Metrics (20% weight). VCs check: Revenue growth rate (MoM/YoY), customer growth, retention/churn. Benchmark: Need 10%+ MoM growth for VC interest, <5% monthly churn.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **"Vanity Metrics - Misleading statistics (inflated user registrations, purchased followers, manipulated revenue curves) mask poor fundamentals. 100,000 registered users when only 3% are active."** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail

- **The pattern appears consistently. Founders obsess over total registrations rather than daily active users. They celebrate social media engagement without tracking conversion rates.** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Unit Economics & Efficiency Metrics. VCs check: CAC payback <12mo, LTV/CAC >3x, gross margin >70%, improving trends. Benchmark: Operational leverage improving as you scale.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **Focus on building an environment of collaboration and open communication to ensure everyone is working towards the same goal.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

- **VC Criteria: Operational Leverage & Automation. VCs check: Automation deployed, processes optimised, cost per unit declining. Benchmark: Operational leverage (revenue grows faster than costs) critical for margins.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://hbr.org/2021/05/why-start-ups-fail

- **Hiring too many people or overextending your marketing budget before really proving your model is insanely risky. You spread yourself too thin and cash burns faster than you can replenish it.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **VC Criteria: Unit Economics & Efficiency Metrics. VCs check: CAC payback <12mo, LTV/CAC >3x, gross margin >70%, improving trends. Benchmark: Operational leverage improving as you scale.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **Startups should concentrate on one core offering, perfect it, and then consider expanding. Maintaining focus and prioritising resources on a single product or service can help startups avoid spreading themselves too thin and ensure they deliver exceptional value to their customers.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/only-8-reasons-startups-fail-how-avoidthem-marshall-hargrave-yoktc/

- **https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.auscorporate.com/business-advice-insights/ten-reasons-startups-fail

- **https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.hubspot.com/startups/resources/top-10-reasons-startups-fail

sections.title: Validation Stage
sections.content:
- **VC Criteria: Growth & Traction Metrics (20% weight). VCs check: Revenue growth rate (MoM/YoY), customer growth, retention/churn. Benchmark: Need 10%+ MoM growth for VC interest, <5% monthly churn.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **https://www.bain.com/insights/topics/net-promoter-score/** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.bain.com/insights/topics/net-promoter-score/

- **Reflect on your mistakes and take the time to understand why they occurred. Making a list of what went wrong and tracking any emerging patterns can help identify weaknesses in your business plan or approach.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **OKRs** (Tool/Framework 1)
  - URL: https://corporatefinanceinstitute.com/resources/business-intelligence/cohort-analysis/

- **KPI Dashboard** (Tool/Framework 2)
  - URL: https://www.bain.com/consulting-services/customer-strategy-and-marketing/net-promoter-score-system/

- **Google Analytics** (Tool/Framework 3)
  - URL: https://hiverhq.com/blog/customer-success-playbook

- **Double Diamond** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://medium.com/digital-experience-design/how-to-apply-a-design-thinking-hcd-ux-or-any-creative-process-from-scratch-b8786efbf812

- **VC Criteria: Growth & Traction Metrics (20% weight). VCs check: Revenue growth rate (MoM/YoY), customer growth, retention/churn. Benchmark: Need 10%+ MoM growth for VC interest, <5% monthly churn.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **"Analytical Thinking (36%) - Failing to confront market data with business goals, leading to poor decisions"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.bain.com/insights/topics/net-promoter-score/

- **https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.capchase.com/blog/the-top-4-reasons-why-startups-fail-and-how-to-avoid-them

- **Human centred design** (Tool/Framework 5)
  - URL: https://www.interaction-design.org/literature/topics/human-centered-design

- **VC Criteria: Unit Economics & CAC/LTV (15% weight). VCs check: CAC/LTV ratio >3x, channel efficiency improving, brand awareness growing. Benchmark: Marketing ROI tracked, profitable channels scaled.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.airtree.vc/open-source-vc/startup-metrics-cac-payback-and-ltv-cac-ratio

- **"Information-Seeking (70% of sample) - Asked the wrong questions to the wrong people and failed to gather data on customer willingness to pay"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.bain.com/insights/topics/net-promoter-score/

- **https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **Set up early warning signals to detect market changes. Talk to customers daily. Have regular check-ins to discuss if any pivots are needed based on learnings. Be ready to change tactics immediately.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **You should employ customer validation techniques such as surveys, focus groups, and beta testing to ensure that their offerings strike a chord with the intended audience.** (Quote (best practice) 2)
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **VC Criteria: Unit Economics & CAC/LTV (15% weight). VCs check: CAC/LTV ratio >3x, channel efficiency improving, brand awareness growing. Benchmark: Marketing ROI tracked, profitable channels scaled.** (VC requirements mapping)
  - URL: https://www.thevccorner.com/p/what-venture-capitalists-look-for

- **"Lack of Proven Product-Market Fit - Companies scale before validating that customers actually want their solution. 34% of startup failures stem from lack of product-market fit"** (Quote (startup failure))
  - URL: https://www.entrepreneur.com/starting-a-business/is-your-startup-all-show-and-no-substance/497762

- **https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate** (Quote (startup failure) 2)
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

- **Validate your assumptions quickly and cheaply, and if needed - pivot.** (Quote (best practice))
  - URL: https://www.failory.com/blog/startup-failure-rate

  - Context: Define-Measure-Analyse-Improve-Control problem-solving. Structured approach to process improvement. More rigorous than PDSA. Use when you have data and need systematic root cause analysis.

- **Name** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://support.content.office.net/en-us/media/8f704492-5800-4885-aa5c-7176d7a7539f.gif
  - Context: Visualise end-to-end process flow. Shows material and information flow, highlights waste and delays. Essential for identifying where value is added vs lost. Use before process redesign or automation.

- **Further info** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://www.atlassian.com/continuous-delivery/principles/value-stream-mapping
  - Context: Visualise end-to-end process flow. Shows material and information flow, highlights waste and delays. Essential for identifying where value is added vs lost. Use before process redesign or automation.

- **Name** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/2YQ2KTv-NiIdYLzNWy8T3dlEQVAEbf0_M3A7gqlrjyB4pb77jrMyh3NYeAkaZnB1TxU4ZuDlGcfunStHnNN_j9PPwB9ImIXSx0rMpmbJQ_6bw8ZMY_bnv_zLC5JTRLhBTurC-Tdm
  - Context: TIMWOODS waste categories: Transport, Inventory, Motion, Waiting, Overproduction, Overprocessing, Defects, Skills (unused). Lean thinking foundation. Startups should especially watch for overproductio...

  - Context: TIMWOODS waste categories: Transport, Inventory, Motion, Waiting, Overproduction, Overprocessing, Defects, Skills (unused). Lean thinking foundation. Startups should especially watch for overproductio...

- **Name** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://www.epa.gov/sites/default/files/2016-11/5s.gif
  - Context: Workplace organisation method: Sort, Set in Order, Shine, Standardise, Sustain. Creates visual, organised work environment. Applicable to digital workspaces too - file organisation, code repositories,...

- **Name** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://cdn.botpenguin.com/assets/website/Just_in_time_inventory_7ac7ca2e49.png
  - Context: Inventory and production timing strategy. Minimise inventory by producing/ordering only when needed. Reduces cash tied up in stock. Relevant for physical product startups or service delivery timing.

- **Name** (Tool/Framework)
  - URL: https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTkq4izC9MIiA4VSyzB1RLkrBTwc6Pg-bp_lQ&s
  - Context: Visual workflow management. Limit work-in-progress, pull work when capacity allows. Simple To Do → Doing → Done boards. Less prescriptive than Scrum - good starting point for small teams.

  - URL: https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6484144ee6dda9d4b9ab7f57/6544f4ebc7d91c0e9783ac8d_Prevention%20poka%20yoke.webp
  - Context: Design processes to prevent errors. Build checks that make mistakes impossible or immediately visible. Examples: confirmation dialogs, validation rules, checklists. Reduces reliance on human vigilance...

  - URL: https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/657b0bc6e1bbc3dc8b83106c/65824b2e2739452b56b4be6c_AndonSystem.jpeg
  - Context: Real-time status signalling system. Originated as factory lights showing machine status. Modern equivalent: dashboards, alerts, monitoring. Enables rapid response to problems. Transparency builds acco...
